Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Statuette of a Seated Schoolgirl
Description: The painted terra-cotta statuette depicts a seated schoolgirl writing her lesson with a stylus on a waxed wooden tablet, which she holds with her hand. She sits on a Greek chair with a footstool. She is looking forward innocently and the eyes are well depicted with raised eyebrows.Her face is fleshy and well featured and the hair is long, surrounding the face and covering the ears.
